results.title: Catherine the Great: a profile in power
results.creator_credit: Look Hear Productions, Learning Corporation of America and Arthur Voronka
results.brief_description: Explores, through use of an imaginary historical interview, the life and the role of Catherine the Great of Russia. Cast includes Zoe Caldwell and Patrick Watson. Written by Patrick Withrow. Suitable for secondary school level.

results.title: Catherine Parr
results.creator_credit: BBC, Ronald Travers, Mark Shivas and Naomi Capon
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “The Six wives of Henry VIII”.
Having been forced to marry the gross and ageing King, Catherine Parr then finds herself protesting accusations of heresy. But the unpretentious Queen rises above the storm and proves to be the only wife whose courageous honesty, directness and shining intellect endear rather than anger King Henry. She is also the only wife to survive her marriage and outlive the most notorious king in history.

results.title: Catherine Howard
results.creator_credit: BBC, Ronald Travers, Mark Shivas and Naomi Capon
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “The Six wives of Henry VIII”.
Henry VIII is enchanted by the young and beautiful Catherine Howard; she is in love with the glamorous thought of being Queen of England. But her physical distaste for the King, her vanity, immaturity, indiscretion and adultery lead her, with her lover, to a bitter end.

results.title: Cathedrale, la Ville, L'ecole = The cathedral, the city, the school
results.brief_description:
During the XIIth century, the centres of innovation are moving away from the monastries towards the cathedrals. Times are changing and what matters is now the secular world, the merchants and the bishop. Cathedrals are not simply devised for religious celebration, they are also civic centres where town meetings are held and to which the guilds of merchants contribute magnificent stainglass windows. During this period of urban revival, money flows towards the building of cathedrals in Reims, Laon, Chartres, Bourges, etc …

Credits: Director, Roland Darbois ; writers, Roger Stephane, Roland Darbois, photography, Roland Dantigny.
Cast: Narrated by Georges Duby.

results.title: Cathedral city
results.creator_credit: Gaumont-British Instructional, Frank Wells and Don Chaffey
results.brief_description: A celluloid pilgramage to the seat of the Anglican Church, the Church of Christ Cathedral in Canterbury. After a solemn survey of noteworthy cathedral features, the film explores the larger city in relation to the dominant architectural edifice.

results.title: Caterpillar
results.brief_description: An animated story about a little boy and a small, green caterpillar that dances to the catchy tune the little boy plays on his mouth organ. Discovered by an entrepreneur, they soon become big business until the caterpillar seemingly disappears.

results.title: Catchwords: ideas for spelling
results.creator_credit: Educational Technology Unit, Toorak State College and O. Hollander
results.brief_description: Charles Cripps, author of the spelling manual “Catchwords” is interviewed by Sue Brockfield and Howard Mould. Cripps outlines several strategies useful for the teaching of spelling. He strongly advocates the “look, cover, write and check” system which is explained during the interview.

results.title: Catchment Boards at work: Nelson
results.creator_credit: New Zealand National Film Unit and Apex Films
results.brief_description: How cultivation of the Nelson Province is being extended by scientific treatment of the soil; also, how further erosion is being prevented by control of the river catchments. Shows the co-ordinated program in the upper catchment areas and river control in the lower parts of the district. Commentary by Bill Beavis. Photography by George Hobbs.
